alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Bath; Craig; Giles (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 3:21PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Alleghany County in west central Virginia, Giles and western Craig Counties in southwestern Virginia, western Bath County in west central Virginia, southeastern Greenbrier and Monroe Counties in southeastern West Virginia through 415 PM EDT... At 320 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Greenbank to near Peterstown. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alleghany... Covington... Lewisburg... Pearisburg... White Sulphur Springs... Narrows... and Ronceverte. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southwestern Virginia. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southwestern and west central Virginia...and southeastern West Virginia.
